text:
A general view southward from No. 1 Hanson Place, the Williamsburg Savings Bank Building. The broad, white thoroughfare running across the face of the view is Flatbush Avenue, with the B. M. T. "El" on it (foreground) turning in on Fifth Avenue. On the left is Atlantic Avenue and the Long Island Railroad yards between the latter and Pacific Street.

May 12, 1939
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr
title: General View - Brooklyn - Flatbush Avenue.

title: General View - Brooklyn - Flatbush Avenue.

text:
Flatbush Avenue, at the intersection of Fifth Avenue, viewing north up the former and showing the B. M. T. elevated line thereon. The trolley is turning in and is continuing down Fifth Avenue. Across the "El" is the Williamsburg Savings Bank Building.

View 2 shows the gas station at the intersection of Flatbush and Fifth Avenues (right, view 1) and the rears of several rookeries fronting on Atlantic Avenue. Flatbush Avenue is on the left and the Williamsburg Savings Bank Building in the background.

Views 1,2
June 14, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Flatbush Avenue, at the intersection of Fifth Avenue, viewing north up the former and showing the B. M. T. elevated line thereon. The trolley is turning in and is continuing down Fifth Avenue. Across the "El" is the Williamsburg Savings Bank Building.

View 2 shows the gas station at the intersection of Flatbush and Fifth Avenues (right, view 1) and the rears of several rookeries fronting on Atlantic Avenue. Flatbush Avenue is on the left and the Williamsburg Savings Bank Building in the background.

Views 1,2
June 14, 1940

P. L. Sperr
